parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post contains "CMF11240002" at the end. This strongly suggests it is electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are used for tracking campaign finance and are mandatory for political advertising in Romania.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions "Ilie Bolojan" and promotes the PNL (National Liberal Party) list for the Bucharest parliamentary elections.  This directly refers to a candidate and a political party participating in the elections, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, targeting a wide audience in Bucharest, as evidenced by the reach estimate of ">1M" and the detailed targeting data in the `aaa_info` section. This clearly addresses the wide population, not just a select few.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to encourage voters to vote for the PNL list in Bucharest. The phrase "Votează lista PNL București pentru alegerile #Parlamentare!" explicitly calls for a vote.  The mention of Ilie Bolojan's project further reinforces this electoral objective, aiming to influence voters' choices. This fulfills Article 36 (7) - c.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic. It lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic content. Instead, it promotes a specific candidate and party with a clear call to action.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post presents Ilie Bolojan's project as a positive attribute, but this is presented within the context of an electoral campaign, not as a personal opinion separate from the election.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>585218097425254</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to a specific candidate (Ilie Bolojan), is used during the electoral campaign period (although the end date is given as after the election, the post was active during the campaign), has a clear electoral objective (influencing votes for PNL), and targets a wide audience through a paid Facebook advertisement. The presence of the CMF number further strengthens this conclusion.  While the content is concise, it directly promotes a candidate and party, leaving no room for interpretation as anything other than electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Ilie Bolojan</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PNL</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
[Partidul Național Liberal], pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu ID-ul postării 585218097425254, care promovează candidatul Ilie Bolojan și lista PNL București pentru alegerile parlamentare, folosind fraze precum „Votează lista PNL București pentru alegerile #Parlamentare!” și prezentând proiectul lui Ilie Bolojan într-un mod evident electoral, cu scopul de a influența votul alegătorilor.  Prezența numărului CMF11240002 confirmă natura electorală a reclamei, demonstrând intenția de a influența rezultatul alegerilor.  Reclama, deși concisă, îndeplinește toate criteriile propagandei electorale, conform articolului 36 (7) din LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006, fiind astfel o încălcare clară a legislației.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
